properties.name: BadAss Burlesque Halloween
properties.description: Posted by Bianca2000308 Bowery, New York, NYBowery Poetry Club 308 Bowery, between Houston and Bleecker, Manhattan 10p; 5 Badass Burlesque BadAss Burlesque Halloween Fuck bobbing for apples: Celebrate your Halloween the old-fashioned way, with horror images and debauchery, plus Hooch-God Moonshine lubricating you all-nite long. See burlesque stars bring the massive cavalcade of badditude and hyperactive mojo. DJ Saint Eve pushes your boundaries throughout the night, with a heathen-wear runway by Deity. Then Vulgaras Live rocks and shocks you along with the World Famous Bob, Bunny Love, Bambi, Rose Wood, Mish Val De Vil, Julie Atlas Muz, Nasty Canasta, Deity, Tigger, Kit Cat, Darlinda Just Darlinda, Belle Morte Baudelaire, Amber Ray and Muffinhead, and Miss AstriD. Hosted by Scotty the Blue Bunny. via Nonsense NYC

properties.name: Blood Manor every weekend in October, 2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 542 West 27th Street, new York, NY2006, October 6-8, 12-15, 19-22, and 26-31Tickets: 0 in advance, 5 at the door, 0 Express EntryBlood Manor is 5,000 square feet of terror. This bloodcurdling labyrinth includes 11 themed rooms of horror and NYC\'s only haunted 3-D maze, where guests receive 3-D glasses to view ghastly images as demons, monsters and ghouls stalk them. Blood Manor is meant to be intense and scary and is not recommended for those under 14 years of age.

properties.name: Boo at the Zoo 10/28-29/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  When: October 28 & 29, 2006 Admission: Free with zoo admission Celebrate Halloween with the animals of the Central Park Zoo. Watch animal residents devour Halloween treats, take part in "spooktacular" activities, and make creative Halloween crafts.

properties.name: CMJ Music Marathon 10/31/06-11/04/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 70 Lincoln Center Plaza, NY, NYStarts at 9am. the 2006 CMJ Music Marathon, which will take place Oct 31-Nov 4 at Lincoln Center as well as at venues across New York City. While new music rules the nighttime, daytime events include panel discussions, mentoring sessions, interviews, exhibits, exclusive film screenings, and even more live performances. As in previous years, 12,000 music professionals and 100,000 fans are expected to be a part of CMJ Music Marathon. More than 1,000 artists spanning all genres will perform throughout the five-day festival. Attendees can also check out CMJ FilmFest, which last year hosted award-winning films such as Walk The Line, A History Of Violence, Thumbsucker, Martin Scorcese\'s No Direction Home and Elizabethtown. Previous CMJ FilmFests have featured appearances by Quentin Tarantino, Michael Moore, Harmony Korine, Trey Parker and Matt Stone, and Mike Mills among other visionary directors. get tickets

properties.name: Critical Mass Halloween Bike Ride 10/27/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  Critical Mass is a monthly celebration of bicycles and other nonpolluting transportation, exercising our right to the road. Wear a costume, dress spooky!

properties.name: Devils 'n' Dolls Halloween Parade Afterparty
properties.description: Posted by Bianca2000 179 MacDougal Street, NYvia Nonsense NYC Love 179 MacDougal Street, near 8th Street, Manhattan 9p-late; 0 RSVP, 5 door Gemini and Scorpio Gemini and Scorpio present: Devils \'n\' Dolls Halloween Parade Afterparty Dance all night in one of the best hot spots in New York: a club with a state-of-the-art sound system, wall-sized movie screen, waterfall, and a plush-covered climbable chillout room. Open vodka bar 9-10p, live big Balkan brass blowout by Hungry March Band, French visitors Les Ouiches Lorenes, and the exuberant Zlatne Uste. Plus DJs Aaroneus, ¢hange, and a late night heavy bass set from Jason Blackkat. Blacklight face and body painting by all-seeing mystik painteresse Elyzabeth. Devilish go-go dancers, midnight witch coven ritual, and a special goth doll prizes for best devils and dolls.

properties.name: Dog Costume Contest 10/28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingMyrtle Ave, Brookly, NYThe 8th Annual Great PUPkin Halloween Costume Contest for Dogs Sat, Oct. 28, 2006. noon-1:00 pm. Ft. Greene Park, at the top of the hill, near the visitor station. Follow the signs at park entrances for the registration location. (rain date Sunday, October 29, same time and place). Registration starts at 11:30 at the top of the hill, near the monument. A suggested donation of .00 per dog. via about.com

properties.name: Free Theater: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
properties.description: Posted by Bianca2000  258 Wythe Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11211Zebulon North 3rd Street and Wythe, Williamsburg, Brooklyn 9p; One-night play, performed by the Dome Theatre Company, adapted by Forrest Gillespie. A scarred and scared city recoils at the foul visage of the night\'s fiercest fiend, Mr. Hyde, extracted from the two faces good and worse, Dr. Jekyll sheds his skin and walks away a newly minted man. Death ensues blood in the aisles. Come share a glass with the other lost souls of the night, huddle together for comfort on this all soul\'s night. Plus music by Amanda Cole, and music by Jordie Wheeler and Mike Wexler. via Nonsense NYC

properties.name: Ghostly Tales and Tours 10/20-21 & 27-28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname 29 East 4th Street, new York, NY2006, Friday & Saturday, October 20 & 21 and October 27 & 28. 7:00 pm-10:00 pm Merchant\'s House Museum, 29 East 4th Street between Lafayette and the Bowery. Take the N,R to 8th St.f, the 6 to Astor Place, or the F,B to Broadway/Lafayette 0, 3 members. Reservations and prepayment are required. Contact 212-777-1089 or YC1832@merchantshouse.com for more information. The old Merchant\'s House in the Village was built in 1832 and has been the site of nine deaths and eight family funerals. Take a spooky candlelit tour of the old mansion and explore tableaus depicting the death rituals of the 19th century. Hear spine-tingling tales of the spirits rumored to walk the halls of the old house.

properties.name: Ghouls and Gourds 10/29/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname1000 Washington Avenue, Brooklyn NY 11225Ghouls & Gourds Sunday, October 29, Noon–4:30 p.m. Let the "wild rumpus" start! Bring your costumes, instruments, and silly attitudes and prepare to be charmed by one of New York City\'s wackiest Halloween extravaganzas. Hot Peas \'N Butter—who stunned audiences from Symphony Space to the Tribeca Film Festival with their upbeat blend of Puerto Rican bomba plena, American folk, and groovy R&B—will have audiences of all ages dancing in the grass. The group will be joined by nine-year-old Puerto Rican dance prodigy Alize Roid. Rebecca Frezza and her Big Truck Band became an instant smash hit on Nickelodeon cable television with her song about gardening entitled H²O + O² + Sun. She promises to bring that song and more of her award-winning high octane rock \'n\' roll sounds to BBG audiences on the Cherry Esplanade. Parent\'s Choice Gold Award–winner Billy Jonas returns from Asheville, North Carolina, to sing about recycling, watermelon seeds, and Mount St. Helen with his one-man "industrial re-percussion" band. Plus use Sassafras-leaf rubbings to make a "ghost portrait," check out displays of "shrunken apple heads" and Thai pumpkin carving, or make your own recycled instrument to take home. The afternoon culminates with a Halloween costume parade led by drummers from the Brazilian percussion corps, Maracatu NY. Visiting ghouls and goblins can march to the beat of hundreds of zany percussion instruments, carry an assortment of larger-than-life puppets, or just show off their own costumes for all to see! via about.com

properties.name: Halloween Dog Parade 10/28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  Saturday, October 28th, 2006 from Noon to 3:00 pm (time approximate, rain date is on Sunday) Where: First Run is located inside NYC\'s Tompkins Square Park near the entrance at 9th St. and Ave. A. Take the L to 1st Ave. Admission: Price of admission is a raffle ticket sold at the door. For more information, please visit www.FirstRunFriends.org Your dog can win you an iPod Nano. On October 28th, hundreds of costumed canines and thousand of spectators will march on Tompkins Square Park to participate in the country_s largest Halloween parade for dogs. This year, the pooches will be competing for over ,000 in prizes (categories include Best in Show, Best Owner & Dog Costume, and Best Trick). Prizes will include two Apple iPod Nano MP3 Players and a weekend getaway for pooch and owner. All proceeds go to the N. Y. Parks department for the renovation of First Run -- the city\'s oldest dog run.

properties.name: Halloween Festival 10/28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   85 South Oxford, Brooklyn, NY, 11217Fort Greene Park Conservancy The 7th Annual Halloween Festival in Fort Greene Park: Saturday, October 28th, 12 noon - 3 pm Face painters, some clowns, bean bag toss games, sack races, a pumpkin patch with pumpkins for painting, a children\'s costume parade & contest, live musical performances, a dog costume contest (see above), and a horse-driven hay ride, are part of the free festival. Come to the park\'s main lawn near the DeKalb/Washington Park entrance. Contact the Fort Greene Park Conservancy at (718) 222-1461. via about.com

properties.name: Halloween Spooktacular 10/27-28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  347 West 36th, new York, NYFriday, October 27th and Saturday, October 28th, 2006. Shows at 7:30 pm and 10 pm.National Comedy Theatre 347 West 36th Street between 8th and 9th Avenues.5 for adults and 2 for students, seniors and kids. For reservations, call 212-629-5202 or visit the National Comedy Theatre\'s web site. The National Comedy Theatre\'s Halloween Spooktacular is a Halloween improv comedy show described by producers as " sort of a combination Friday the 13th meets whose line is it." Every show features spooky games and an ending promised to be so bizarre that it will be discussed until Thanksgiving. The show is appropriate for all ages.

properties.name: Halloween parade and Pumpkin Sail 10/29/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Halloween Parade and Pumpkin Sail Where: The Charles A. Dana Discovery Center, inside the Park at 110th Street between Fifth and Lenox Avenues When: Saturday, October 29, 2PM-5PM Admission: FREE Bring a carved jack-o-latern (10 pounds or less) and dress in your Halloween finery to join this parade around the Harlem Meer. Judges will award prizes for the best costumes. The event will conclude with a flotilla of candle-lit pumpkins sailing across the Harlem Meer. It\'s free for all ages. For more information, call 212-860-1370.

properties.name: Halloween the Movie Showing Oct 23, 2006
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   9727 Seaview Ave. Brooklyn, NYMonday, October 23, at 6:00 pm, View Halloween the Movie, the cult classic in honor of Halloween, featuring Jamie Lee Curtis. For adult audiences. via about.com

properties.name: Harvest Festival 10/28-29/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  145 Brooklyn Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11213 Halloween and Harvest Festival Weekend, October 28-29 at the Brooklyn Children\'s Museum Make a spider, get your face painted, and hear spooky stories. Come in costume, if you like. Due to construction, the Museum will not be hosting Monster Mash this year. The Museum will be closed on October 31. via about.com

properties.name: Haunted Carnival for Kids 10/28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  339 8th Street Brooklyn, NYSaturday, October 28, 2006. Join Puppetry Arts Theatre and Camp Friendship for a Haunted Halloween Carnival from 2pm - 6pm. Fun includes a costume contest for kids and dogs too, Haunted Monster Lab, Bounce House and the first 200 kids get a free Trick-or-Treat bag. Small fee for snacks and fun. At Camp Friendship. via about.com

properties.name: Haunted Prospect Park 10/29/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Haunted Walk and Carnival, 12 - 3 p.m. Take a scary walk through Prospect Park\'s woods, haunted by friendly gouls and goblins. Explore Lookout Hill and emerge in the Nethermead for a carnival full of fun, games, and surprises. Free. Begin at Prospect Park Southwest and 16th Street. October 28 only! Haunted Carousel, 12 - 5 p.m. Chilling music, ravens, bats, and spiders make spin on the Carousel a spooky treat. .50. Also October 29. Scary Stories from the Past, 2 & 3 p.m. Meet the old ghosts of Flatbush in haunting tales passed down from Lefferts ancestors. Free. Lefferts Historic House. Also October 29. Skeleton Scharen-Knippen Cut-Outs, 1 - 4 p.m. Make your own Halloween headbands using a traditional paper-cutting artform. Free. Lefferts Historic House. Also October 29. Creepy Crawly Halloween, 12 - 5 p.m. Creepy crafts, live critters and hands-on experiments. For families with children ages 3 to 12. Free. Audubon Center. Also October 29. Boo at the Zoo, 10 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Face painting, craft making, encounters with "spooky" creatures and a trip throught the Zoo\'s legendary haunted barn. Free with Zoo admission. Also October 29. via about.com

properties.name: Heavenly Horrors Halloween Ball
properties.description: Posted by Bianca200070 N 6th St, Williamsburg, Brooklyn, NYGalapagos 70 North 6th Street, Williamsburg, Brooklyn 8p; Featuring musical fear and loathing by Madam Robot and the Lust Brigade, Your 33 Black Angels, Discovery, Butane Variations, We Are the Arm, and the Heavy Creatures. Hosted and MCed by the lovely Carmen Mofongo. With wicked DJs: January 1963, Alfreako, Lady Byrd, and Matt and Jay. Terrortastic antics and ugly ghoul contest hosted by Bryan Ooozing Brains Fitzgerald. Haunted room designed by NA. via Nonsense NYC

properties.name: Hell House October 2006
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 38 Water St. Brooklyn, NYNow through October 29th at St. Ann\'s Warehouse, Hell House is definitely for mature audiences. Les Freres Corbusier troupe creates a part installation, part performance depiction of church-sponsored hell houses, that show the consequences of sin. Actual evangelical script is used., 38 Water St., between Main and Dock Sts. (718) 254-8779. via about.com

properties.name: Lost Film Fest
properties.description: Posted by Bianca2000279 Church, New York, NYThe Tank 279 Church, at White, Manhattan 9:30p doors, 10p Jekyll, 11p Lost Film Festival; 0 612 735 8366 http://www.thetanknyc.org http://www.lostfilmfest.org Lost Film Fest If you like pranks on corporations and you really hate George W Bush, you\'ll love the Lost Film Fest. The program is hosted by Scott Beibin and travels the planet year round doing over 200 shows in all kinds of settings. It\'s an interactive performance that incorporates politically charged and humorous short films by folks like the Yes Men, Guerrilla News Network, and news that mysteriously doesn\'t make the news (riot porn!). The program changes all the time with new stuff added to the mix. You might even get to see the fabled episode of Jerry Springer with the Locust and Beibin. Don\'t miss your opportunity to catch it when it\'s in town. Tonight\'s show is preceded by a 1920 Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, with a live score by the Devil Music Ensemble. via Nonsense NYC

properties.name: Macabre Walking Tour 10/28/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  Explore the haunted past of Greenwich Village on this annual Halloween walking tour led by historian Joyce Gold. Learn about famous murders and the ghosts that are said to roam downtown Manhattan -- including Edgar Allen Poe. When: Saturday, October 28th, 2006 at 1PM Where: Meet at the Washington Arch on Fifth Avenue just south of 8th Street. Getting There: A,C,E,F,V to West 4th Street, N,R to 8th Street. Tickets: 5, no reservations needed More Information: Call 212-242-5762

properties.name: Park Slope Halloween Parade 10/31/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname   Tuesday, October 31st The Park Slope Civic Council hosts its annual kids\' Halloween parade and party for children of all ages. Parade will start at 7th Avenue and 12th Street and proceed to 7th Avenue and Union Street. Participants may join the parade at any point along this route. The Headless Horsewoman will join the parade, as well as parade bands -- Paprika and Eternal Buzz Brass Band. You can also join the party at 4:30 pm; Prospect Park YMCA. Parade at 6:30 pm.

properties.name: Procession of the Ghouls 10/27/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  1047 Amsterdam Ave, new York, NYFriday, October 27th, 2006 at 7PM and 9PM Visit the magnificent Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine for an evening of thrills and chills. Enjoy a screening of the classic 1922 creepfest Nosferatu, accompanied by the ominous sounds of the cathedral organ. The film is followed by the famous Grand Procession of the Ghouls, a dramatic parade of fabulous puppets, creatures and special effects.Where: Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine, 112th Street and Amsterdam Avenue, one block east of Broadway. Getting There: 1 or 9 train to 110th Street/Cathedral Parkway. M4, M104 bus to Broadway and 112th Street or M11 to Amsterdam Avenue and 112th Street. Tickets: 5, for students and seniors Seating: Space is limited due to restoration work so all seating is general admission, first come-first served. The line for admission for ticket-holders will start outside Cathedral doors 45 minutes to an hour before doors open (doors open one hour prior to performance time). For more information, call 212-316-7540.

properties.name: Raising Kids & Curtains Show 10/29/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname    138 South Oxford St., Brooklyn NY 11225On October 29 The Alliance of Resident Theatres/New York (A.R.T./New York)presents The Sixth Annual Raising Kids and Curtains Halloween Show, a musical storytelling performance of "How the Turtle Got Its Shell" by Shadow Box Theatre. Audience participation is encouraged as the little turtle outsmarts a fierce leopard. Adapted from an African folktale by Sandra Robbins and is performed by Leena Conquest and Ayanda Clarke. Costume parade of audience and performers directly follow the show. Goodie bags will be given out while supplies last. Costumes are encouraged. Doors open at 2:30pm for a 3pm performance. Admission is free and no reservations are required, however space is limited.

properties.name: Scumbo Rocks Oct 31st, 2006
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  485 Dean St., Brooklyn, NYvia Johnny Moon Scumbo will be bringing their brand of original psychedelic music to the stage dressed as a dead mariachi band. There will be fog, lasers, pinatas, and as many surprises as possible. Listen to their music streaming for free on MySpace. Steve Lieberman the gangsta rabbi will also be at the show performing. Steve Lieberman is a bass virtuoso and plays a style unlike anyone else. He has a flute. Be there by 9 PM Halloween night. That\'s October 31st, 2006. The show is free. The location is Freddy\'s Backroom one of the coolest bars in Brooklyn. The beer will not be free, but it is reasonably priced. The address is 485 Dean St. in Brooklyn. Directions By Subway take the 1/2 to Bergen Street; Freddy\'s is right around the corner. Or take practically any train in the city to Atlantic Avenue/Pacific Street Stations; Walk East on Flatbush and take a left on Dean. By Car take Flatbush Avenue. Dean St. and 6th Ave cross Flatbush about a half mile West of Grand Army Plaza and a mile or so East of the Manhattan Bridge.

properties.name: Sea Monsters Weekend 10/28-29/2006
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  602 Surf Ave Brooklyn, NYSaturday and Sunday, Oct. 28-29 At the New York Aquarium on Coney Island, learn all about the monsters of the deep while you enjoy face painting, games, prizes, and other arts & crafts. Children in costume get in free with each paying adult. via about.com

properties.name: Shindig! Halloween
properties.description: Posted by Bianca2000175 Attorney Street, New York175 Attorney Street, between Houston and Stanton, Manhattan 8:30p; 5 donation Shindig\'s MySpace Open Bar all night until we close (or get arrested). Private space, haunted house. Live music from A Place to Bury Strangers, Lions and Tigers, Franco V. and the High Class Elite, and the Films. With a good selection of NYC\'s best DJs including Sean Fightcats, S. Valentine, Mike Nouveau, TKOmri, Brendon James, and Mathilde Hildebrandt. via Nonsense NYC

properties.name: Sleepy Hollow
properties.description: Posted by Bianca2000466 Grand Street, New York, NYAbrons Art Center 466 Grand Street, Manhattan 7:30p; 5 online Continues through SUNDAY 212 352 3101 http://wwww.henrystreet.org/arts Drama of Works presents: Sleepy Hollow Drama of Works premieres their newest full-length work just in time for Halloween. Based on the classic tale by Washington Irving, Sleepy Hollow is a beautifully mounted, large-scale shadow puppet re-telling of the legend. The production features an original score by Vivian Fung, performed live by a chamber ensemble. Directed by Gretchen Van Lente. Puppets designed by James Walton. Tonight: Venture through our own jack-o-lantern filled haunted forest before Drama of Works presents their new hour-long production. via Nonsense NYC

properties.name: Staten Island Nightmare Haunted House until 11/03/06

properties.name: Swalloweenie
properties.description: Posted by Bianca2000 766 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY Stain 766 Grand Street, Williamsburg, Brooklyn 8p; Swalloweenie A reminder about Stain\'s big annual event, the holiday we practice all year long: bobbing for hotdogs! But that\'s optional. The garden gets turned into a graveyard of the year\'s newly deceased, the drinks are all dark and red, the costumes should be ugly, offensive, or dead and prizes will be doled out accordingly. And, best yet, you get to meet the new house cat, black, and apropos to the time, named Poe. As in Edgar Allan. via Nonsense NYC

properties.name: Swalloweenie Radical Vaudeville
properties.description: Posted by Bianca200034 avenue a nyc ny 10009Mo Pitkin\'s 34 Avenue A, between 2nd and 3rd streets, Manhattan 10p; http://www.radicalvaudeville.com http://www.mopitkins.com SwalloweenieRadical Vaudeville Brutally brilliant entertainment done dirt cheap. With this month\'s special guests: Haunted Pussy, Valmonte Sprout, Fifi Dupree, Moonshine, Daisy Tomatoes, and Sean Kershaw. via Nonsense NYC

properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  669 8th Ave., NY, NYSEE! The enchanted mermaid! FEAR! The Monster Reborn! GAWK! At the Dancing Ghouls! Tremble! At the live execution! Join your hostess Coffina, the Dark Mystress of Comedy, on a shocking and hilarious trip through Halloween madness! Thurs.-Sun., Oct. 20-23, 27-30 Shows start every hour from 7pm-Midnighte 5 in Advance, 0 at the Door via Hauntedhouse.com

properties.name: Trapped in Purgatory, every weekend in October 2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  5050 Haylen Blvd. Staten island, NYTrapped in Purgatory will take you through the world of the tortured lost souls and Lucifer\'s Rejects. In Purgatory you\'ll be bombarded by scare after scare and amazing special effects. For more information view our Frequently asked questions below: Are there any kids activities that aren\'t scary? Yes! We have a daytime Pumpkin Playland that is fun for all ages! The playland is open 7 days a week from 8AM until 7PM. For More information on the Greenside Up Pumpkin Playland click here! Are there any special pricing for kids? Yes during the day we have special pricing for our daytime family activities. How long does it take? It depends on how fast you can run! 10-15 minute walkthrough times but that can be cut in half if your running and screaming the whole time! Will there be special effects? Yes we have stobe effects, animated characters and fog machines are also in use. Get tickets

properties.name: Village Costume Ball 10/31/2006
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  155 First Avenue, new York, NYTuesday, October 31, 2006 at 8PMTheatre for the New City. Take the 6 to Astor Place, the N,R,W to 8th Street, or the F,V to 2nd Avenue/Houston Street. Tickets: 0 in advance; 5 at the door. Buy tickets online or call 212-254-1109.For the 30th annual Village Halloween Costume Ball, the creative types from the Theatre for the New City will transform their 30,000 square foot, multilevel space into a Halloween extravaganza. Step inside this theatrical experience featuring sculpture, art, and live performances from more than 450 artists.

properties.name: Village Halloween Costume Ball
properties.description: Posted by Bianca2000155 1st Ave, New York, NYTheater for the New City 155 First Avenue, at the corner of East 10th Street, Manhattan 4p outdoors, 8p indoors; outside, 0 inside, costume or formal wear required Village Halloween Costume Ball Theater for the New City\'s two-story, 30,000 square foot space transformed into a series of Halloween environments by painters and scenic designers. Tap dancers, belly dancers, lounge acts, musicians, and comedy teams will perform throughout the night in two cabarets. The one-night fiesta takes over all four of the theater spaces, plus the lobby and the block of East Tenth Street between First and Second avenues. Customarily over 1,400 wildly-clad celebrants gather for dancing, dining, showing off costumes and viewing acts from the cutting-edge of cabaret and theater. Outside, there are bluegrass and jazz bands, fire-eaters, jugglers, storyweavers, and stilt dancers. Inside, there is theater all evening. via Nonsense NYC

properties.name: Webster Hell, 10/31/06
properties.description: Posted by Us3rname  125 E 11th St, NY, NYJennifer Tilly from "Seed of Chucky" hosts this popular holiday dance party. Also coinciding with the club\'s anniversary, Halloween is just one big excuse for a party where Z-100 broadcasts the festivities live, and everyone enjoys the 8pm to 10pm open bar (well drinks and Budweiser products). Dressing for the day is a must, as is buying your tickets presale. You save 0 with advanced purchase. VIP tickets and table reservations are also available. via Citysearch

properties.name: Zombie Walk
properties.description: Posted by Bianca2000  Walk with the dead for the fourth straight year. We walk the streets a la George Romeros Dawn of the Dead 1978, and visit some of New York\'s busy stores as zombies. Please do a bang up make up job. Union Square 14th Street and University, Manhattan 3p sharp; via Nonsense NYC
